data.title: 'I'm a Vinted pro – my simple hack is guaranteed to sell your clothes faster'
data.meta_description: A mum of two has stirred debate after revealing her simple hack to boost sales on Vinted. While some users swear by the method – others argue it's 'desperate' and doesn't actually work
data.text:
A savvy mum has revealed her genius secret to boosting Vinted sales – without paying a single penny.

Online marketplaces like Vinted are a great way to earn an extra bit of cash from flogging the clothes in your wardrobe you longer care about. You don't have to deal with postage or selling fees, meaning you can keep all your profits for your next shopping spree.

Vinted does provide a paid-for service that allows users to 'bump' their items to the top of people's feeds to encourage sales. However, if you don't want to risk damaging your earnings, there is a simply hack that works just as well.

READ MORE: Vinted customers at war over £2.50 shoes - and everyone is saying the same thing

Mum of two Nicole swears by messaging users that have favourited her items before she does a postal run, informing them that they could get their parcel delivered ASAP if they're interested. "I guarantee you that, if you have like five or six people who have liked the item, someone will buy it," she said on TikTok.

"That means you only have to do one post run with all of your stuff, you get a few extra parcels sold and sorted. It just saves time and obviously sells your items faster."

Straight away, viewers rushed to the comments section to share their thoughts - and it's clear the hack had divided the internet. "I've been doing this for ages and it works," raved one user. Another agreed, commenting: "Completely agree! It's worked so much for me and I've managed to sell loads!" while a third added the hack works 'every time' for her.

However, others branded the hack 'desperate' and argued it would put them off purchasing an item. "I have tried this a lot of people just read it and don't buy," one person stated. Another fumed: "That doesn't work. [I've] tried it but people don't like the pushy approach on Vinted, even for a bargain."
